humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 2 sentinel lymph nodes were examined and found to be negative for metastatic disease (0/2). This corresponds to the new rule 11, which states that N0 can indicate that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 2 sentinel nodes were examined and both were negative for metastatic disease (0/2). This indicates that the cancer has not spread to the lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N0 stage. The presence of mucinous carcinoma in the adipose tissue at the inked medial margin of resection in the pectoralis fascia specimen does not affect the N stage as it is a separate specimen from the sentinel nodes.
